intro: Octomeria lichenicola, commonly known as the lichen-forming fungus, is a species that belongs to the family Graphidaceae. It is characterized by its intricate thallus structure, which is typically crustose and tightly adherent to the substrate. The plant forms a symbiotic relationship with algae or cyanobacteria, which contribute to its photosynthetic capabilities. It is often found on bark or rock surfaces in humid environments. Its chemical composition includes various secondary metabolites that contribute to its ecological role and potential medicinal applications.
